main event: Radar tracking of unidentified objects over Bornholm, Denmark on August 22, 1956
interesting points: The objects were tracked on radar, moving at high speeds of up to 700 knots and orbiting over one spot.
There were no known aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
Attempts to further investigate and evaluate the sighting were hampered by incomplete data and information.
The sighting could not be attributed to any conventional propulsion or aircraft, and remained unexplained.
There was no evidence of any missile or related activity in the radar coverage area that could account for the sighting.
